Project Overview

The Concert Booking System is a Java-based web service designed to simplify ticket reservations for concerts. Built with scalability and performance in mind, this project showcases my backend development skills, focusing on efficiency and reliability in high-demand scenarios such as concert ticket sales.

Features

  • Concert and Performer Information: Users can browse and explore details about concerts, performers, and schedules without logging in.
  • Interactive Seat Map: Visualize seat availability in real-time and reserve seats directly through the interface.
  • Secure Authentication: Users can log in with token-based authentication to view and manage their bookings securely.
  • Double-Booking Prevention: Ensures only one user can book a specific seat for a given concert at a time.
  • Notifications for Sell-Out Events: Users can subscribe to updates for concerts nearing full booking capacity.

Planned Features

The current version of the Concert Booking System is fully functional, but I plan to enhance it with the following features:

  • Dynamic Ticket Pricing: Support for unique ticket prices for each concert.
  • Multi-Venue Support: Manage events across multiple venues with distinct layouts.
  • Hold Reservations: Allow users to temporarily reserve seats during the checkout process to avoid losing selections.

item.title: Gold Miner: A Classic Java Game
item.description:
Gold Miner: A Fun and Challenging Java Game üéÆ

Project Overview

Gold Miner is a Java-based game where players control a claw to collect gold, rocks, and other items to achieve target scores. The game is designed to test the player’s timing and decision-making skills, with increasing difficulty as they progress through levels.

This project highlights my ability to develop engaging and functional games using Java Swing for the GUI and modular code for extensibility.

Features

  • Variety of Items: Includes gold, large rocks, small rocks, and more, each with different point values.
  • Multiple Levels: The game becomes more challenging as players progress, with increased target scores and time limits.
  • Time and Score Mechanics: Players must meet a target score within a set time to advance to the next level.
  • Simple Interface: The game interface is clean and functional, built using Java Swing.
  • Extensibility: The code is modular, making it easy to add new features like items, levels, or mechanics.

Planned Features

While the current version of Gold Miner offers a complete gaming experience, I plan to enhance it in the future with:

  • Background Music and Sound Effects: To improve player engagement.
  • More Levels and Items: To increase replayability and depth.
  • Leaderboard: For tracking and displaying high scores.
  • Enhanced Interactivity: Adding features like power-ups and special abilities.
